Ogre::PagingLandScapeOctreeNode

Ogre::PagingLandScapeOctreeNode Class Reference

#include <OgrePagingLandScapeOctreeNode.h>

Inheritance diagram for Ogre::PagingLandScapeOctreeNode:

[legend]
Collaboration diagram for Ogre::PagingLandScapeOctreeNode:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

Specialized SceneNode that is customized for working within an PagingLandScapeOctree.

Each node maintains it's own bounding box, rather than merging it with all the children.

Member Function Documentation

AxisAlignedBox& Ogre::PagingLandScapeOctreeNode::_getLocalAABB ( void   )  [inline]

Returns the local bounding box of this PagingLandScapeOctreeNode.

Remarks:
This is used to render the bounding box, rather then the global.

Definition at line 103 of file OgrePagingLandScapeOctreeNode.h.

void Ogre::PagingLandScapeOctreeNode::_updateBounds ( void   )  [protected]

Internal method for updating the bounds for this PagingLandScapeOctreeNode.

Remarks:
This method determines the bounds solely from the attached objects, not any children. If the node has changed it's bounds, it is removed from its current PagingLandScapeOctree, and reinserted into the tree.

Definition at line 84 of file OgrePagingLandScapeOctreeNode.cpp.

void Ogre::PagingLandScapeOctreeNode::addChild ( Node *  child  )  [virtual]

Adds a (pre-created) child scene node to this node.

If it is attached to another node, it must be detached first.

Parameters:
child The Node which is to become a child node of this one

void Ogre::PagingLandScapeOctreeNode::attachObject ( MovableObject *  obj  )  [virtual]

Adds an instance of a scene object to this node.

Remarks:
Scene objects can include Entity objects, Camera objects, Light objects, ParticleSystem objects etc. Anything that subclasses from MovableObject.

Definition at line 174 of file OgrePagingLandScapeOctreeNode.cpp.

MovableObject * Ogre::PagingLandScapeOctreeNode::detachObject ( unsigned short  index  )  [virtual]

Detaches the indexed object from this scene node.

Remarks:
Detaches by index, see the alternate version to detach by name. Object indexes may change as other objects are added / removed.

Definition at line 204 of file OgrePagingLandScapeOctreeNode.cpp.

void Ogre::PagingLandScapeOctreeNode::removeAllChildren ( void   )  [virtual]

Removes all child Nodes attached to this node.

Does not delete the nodes, just detaches them from this parent, potentially to be reattached elsewhere.

Definition at line 356 of file OgrePagingLandScapeOctreeNode.cpp.

Node * Ogre::PagingLandScapeOctreeNode::removeChild ( Node *  child  )  [virtual]

Drops the specified child from this node.

Remarks:
Does not delete the node, just detaches it from this parent, potentially to be reattached elsewhere. There is also an alternate version which drops a named child from this node.
